definition: to have secret ties with/to be in covert communication with (the enemy etc)/to engage in an illicit sexual relationship/adultery
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc

sentences.english: The judge is said to have an illicit love affair with a film star.
sentences.chinese: 據說那個法官與一個電影明星私通。

sentences.english: An errant husband is one who leaves his wife for other women.
sentences.chinese: 走邪路的丈夫是指離開自己的妻子去跟別的女人私通。

sentences.english: I'm sorry, adultery should be illegal.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，我認爲私通不應是合法的。

sentences.english: All he had to worry about was whether to have an affair with Mrs Robinson.
sentences.chinese: 他所考慮的只是要不要和羅賓遜夫人私通。

sentences.english: She should have been arrested and we should have had proof that she'd had an illegal affair.
sentences.chinese: 我們本應該逮捕她，並且拿出證據證明她違法私通。

definition: to have an affair with sb
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
to plot a rebellion/to conspire against the state
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
